result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (8th) and Operating w/ PAC (8th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (8th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (8th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven E Boyea was found guilty of OWI (8th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to drive w/o a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to drive with any alcohol in system.  Not to drive any vehicle without Ignition Interlock Device.

Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    $250 represents DNA surcharge.  $35 represents Blood Draw Test fee.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).
